[W]heat and two jars of soap. You will receive from him three large sacks
and three hawsers. Lock them up in a safe place.
Be sure to keep all my half-share of the load in
a warehouse, next to the rest of the marchandise. Whatever you want, just order it [from me].
I have sent you high-quality rice, a fine kiswa-robe, tailored in
pure silk, fine shawls, and fine galabiya clothes,
along with six tillīs-sacks of flax, and ten qitʿa-units of flour.
Put all of my half-share [of the shipment] in one place,
and use the crops to pay for (?) the zakāt taxes. Put them,
for my sake, in a safe place. Peace be upon you and Najīb.
Praise be to God alone. And [......]
Peace be upon Khalaf. Tell Khalaf that, by God, by God,
send me the baṭṭa-containers as soon as possible! I need
them [badly .............].
If the cakes have all run out, then send along flour, in six large containers. Send the crops to me on four riding animals and [......].
